The archer's movements, particularly the draw of the bow and the release of the arrow, are smooth and elongated, which is characteristic of slow motion footage. This is a technique often used to highlight the details of an action that is too fast to be appreciated in real-time, especially in sports like archery where precision and technique are key.

The other options do not fit this description: 'normal' would show the clock moving at real-time speed, 'backwards' would show the clock hands moving in the reverse direction, and 'double' does not accurately describe any known video recording technique related to speed.
